div.l: Thiese clerkis beten hym wele · and leete hym lye
And graytheden hem · and tooke theyr hors anon
And eeke theyr mele · and on theyr wey they gon
And at the Mille · yit they toke theyr cake
Of half a busshel floure · ful wele I bake
Thus is the prowde Miller wel I bete
And hath lost · the gryndyng of his whete
And paide for the sovper eủerydel
Of Alayn and Iohn that bete hym wel
His wif is I swyved · and his dought̉er als
Lo what it is a Miller to be fals
And therfor this proverbe is seide ful soth
Hym dare nat wene wele · that yvel doth
A guylour shal hym self · be guyled be
And god that sittith · hie in mageste
Save al this compaignie grete and smale
Thus have I quyt · the Miller in his tale
¶ Here endith the Reves tale
¶ The prolog of the Cokes tale
THe Cooke of london̄ · while the Reve spak
For Ioye hym thought · he clawd hym on the bak
A ha quod he · for cristes passioun̄
This Miller had · a sharp conclusioun̄
Vpon his argument · of herbegage
Wele saide Salamon · in his langage
Ne bryng nat eủery man · in to thyn hous
For herborwyng bi nyght is ꝑperilous
